function.name: GEOPGeoGsm
function.syntax: void GEOPGeoGsm(int yr,int mo,int dy,int hr,int mt,double sc,double *bgeo,double *bgsm);

description.p: The GEOPGeoGsm function converts from geographic to Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric (GSM) coordinates.

The arguments yr, mo, dy, hr, mt, and sc give the UT time for the conversion. The argument bgeo points to an array containing the X, Y, and Z components of the geographic coordinate. The components of the GSM coordinate are stored in the array pointed to by the argument bgsm.

function.name: GEOPGseGsm
function.syntax: void GEOPGseGsm(int yr,int mo,int dy,int hr,int mt,double sc,double *bgse,double *bgsm);

description.p: The GEOPGseGsm function converts from Geocentric Solar Ecliptic (GSE) to Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric (GSM) coordinates.

The arguments yr, mo, dy, hr, mt, and sc give the UT time for the conversion. The argument bgse points to an array containing the X, Y, and Z components of the GSE coordinate. The components of the GSM coordinate are stored in the array pointed to by the argument bgsm.

function.name: GEOPGsmGeo
function.syntax: void GEOPGsmGeo(int yr,int mo,int dy,int hr,int mt,double sc,double *bgsm,double *bgeo);

description.p: The GEOPGsmGeo function converts from Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric (GSM) to geographic coordinates.

The arguments yr, mo, dy, hr, mt, and sc give the UT time for the conversion. The argument bgsm points to an array containing the X, Y, and Z components of the GSM coordinate. The components of the geographic coordinate are stored in the array pointed to by the argument bgeo.

function.name: GEOPGsmGse
function.syntax: void GEOPGsmGse(int yr,int mo,int dy,int hr,int mt,double sc,double *bgsm,double *bgse);

description.p: The GEOPGsmGse function converts from Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric (GSM) to Geocentric Solar Ecliptic coordinates.

The arguments yr, mo, dy, hr, mt, and sc give the UT time for the conversion. The argument bgsm points to an array containing the X, Y, and Z components of the GSM coordinate. The components of the GSE coordinate are stored in the array pointed to by the argument bgse.

function.name: GEOPGsmSm
function.syntax: void GEOPGsmSm(int yr,int mo,int dy,int hr,int mt,double sc,double *bgsm,double *bsm);

description.p: The GEOPGeoGsm function converts from Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric (GSM) to Solar Magnetic (SM) coordinates.

The arguments yr, mo, dy, hr, mt, and sc give the UT time for the conversion. The argument bgsm points to an array containing the X, Y, and Z components of the GSM coordinate. The components of the SM coordinate are stored in the array pointed to by the argument bsm.

function.name: GEOPSmGsm
function.syntax: void GEOPSmGsm(int yr,int mo,int dy,int hr,int mt,double sc,double *bsm,double *bgsm);

description.p: The GEOPSmGsm function converts from Solar Magnetic to Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric (GSM) coordinates.

The arguments yr, mo, dy, hr, mt, and sc give the UT time for the conversion. The argument bsm points to an array containing the X, Y, and Z components of the SM coordinate. The components of the GSM coordinate are stored in the array pointed to by the argument bgsm.
